link.naam: The last word my grandfather said was “gizmos”.
Stronger than our genetic slides are contraptions. A slow modification of the modified.
A buttress is a wheel is a light sensor is the sputtered and failing front porch light.
Humans cannot stop creating, altering the internal, the external bubble.
Our beginnings/endings are sweeping arenas of electricity
and pesticides and the avoidance of gravity.
Even the diminishing distance between your vehicle and domicile is legislated
by the inherited burst of “how can they be changed”.
The weather-thin abandonment of where the diagram ends.
Humans cannot stop creating, altering the internal, the external bubble.
And if this marriage of our internal code and the gadgets we bloom
is concretely real, then machines are useless.
Carrying tiers, copulated steps, iron and granite
and a wooden spiral built for climbing down.
People keep files or folders for pretend, pretending that gardens,
those shrubbed enclosures, are enough to keep the birds away.
Are enough to pause the missing stain.
For every second story there is an attic,
and for every attic there is another second story.
